item.title: Free Speech Legal Center Threatens To Sue Trump For Blocking Twitter Users
item.description: June 7, 2017 - A First Amendment law center at Columbia University is threatening to sue President Trump if he doesn't stop blocking people whose comments he doesn't like on Twitter. The group says Trump cannot lawfully block people from viewing what they contend are presidential statements.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 7, 2017 - A First Amendment law center at Columbia University is threatening to sue President Trump if he doesn't stop blocking people whose comments he doesn't like on Twitter. The group says Trump cannot lawfully block people from viewing what they contend are presidential statements. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/07/531945516/free-speech-legal-center-threatens-to-sue-trump-for-blocking-twitter-users

item.title: Can The Nation's Voting System Be Trusted?
item.description:
June 7, 2017 - How can we best protect a system that delivers the peaceful transfer of power?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-07/can-the-nations-voting-system-be-trusted-working-title
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Apple Takes On Distracted Driving With New Feature
item.description:
June 6, 2017 - The new feature blocks notifications while users are driving, but a loophole could allow text messages to still pop up.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/06/531777684/apple-takes-on-distracted-driving-with-new-feature
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: The Internet Of Things Is Becoming More Difficult To Escape
item.description: June 6, 2017 - In coming years, human and machine connectivity will continue to progress, despite concerns about vulnerabilities, making it increasingly difficult to withdraw from online tools, experts say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - In coming years, human and machine connectivity will continue to progress, despite concerns about vulnerabilities, making it increasingly difficult to withdraw from online tools, experts say. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/06/531747037/the-internet-of-things-is-becoming-more-difficult-to-escape

item.title: Can The Democracy Survive The Internet?: Lessons From 2016
item.description:
June 6, 2017 - "Can democracy survive the Internet?" Why one scholar was prompted to explore that question following the 2016 U.S. election.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-06/can-democracy-survive-the-internet
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 6, 2017 - "Can democracy survive the Internet?" Why one scholar was prompted to explore that question following the 2016 U.S. election. http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-06/can-democracy-survive-the-internet

item.title: Before Silicon Valley, New Jersey Reigned As Nation's Center Of Innovation
item.description: June 5, 2017 - Silicon Valley is known as the nation's tech hub, but decades ago New Jersey had that distinction. The state was once home to Thomas Edison's lab and Bell Labs, the home of Nobel laureates.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - Silicon Valley is known as the nation's tech hub, but decades ago New Jersey had that distinction. The state was once home to Thomas Edison's lab and Bell Labs, the home of Nobel laureates. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/05/531250084/before-silicon-valley-new-jersey-reigned-as-nations-center-of-innovation

item.title: Apple Joins Smart-Speaker Race With Music-Focused 'HomePod'
item.description: June 5, 2017 - The speaker is powered by Apple's personal assistant Siri and marks the long-awaited entry of the tech giant into competition with Amazon's and Google's smart home devices.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - The speaker is powered by Apple's personal assistant Siri and marks the long-awaited entry of the tech giant into competition with Amazon's and Google's smart home devices. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/05/531594351/apple-joins-smart-speaker-race-with-music-focused-homepod

item.title: Audible Offers Lottery For Employees To Live 1 Year Rent-Free In Newark, N.J.
item.description: June 5, 2017 - The headquarters for Audible are in Newark, N.J. Earlier this year, it offered a lottery for employees — free rent for a year to live in an a building in downtown of the much-maligned city.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - The headquarters for Audible are in Newark, N.J. Earlier this year, it offered a lottery for employees — free rent for a year to live in an a building in downtown of the much-maligned city. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/05/531629211/audible-offers-lottery-for-employees-to-live-1-year-rent-free-in-newark-n-j

item.title: Trump Announces Plan To Privatize Air Traffic Control
item.description: June 5, 2017 - It's an idea long supported by most of the commercial airlines and the union, which say the system is inefficient under the Federal Aviation Administration.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 5, 2017 - It's an idea long supported by most of the commercial airlines and the union, which say the system is inefficient under the Federal Aviation Administration. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/05/531574945/trump-announces-plan-to-privatize-air-traffic-control

item.title: Videotapes Are Becoming Unwatchable As Archivists Work To Save Them
item.description: June 3, 2017 - With VHS tapes degrading, most Americans' home videos from the '80s and '90s won't be viewable in a decade. But there's a grassroots movement to preserve them for posterity.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 3, 2017 - With VHS tapes degrading, most Americans' home videos from the '80s and '90s won't be viewable in a decade. But there's a grassroots movement to preserve them for posterity. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/03/529155865/videotapes-are-becoming-unwatchable-as-archivists-work-to-save-them

item.title: Massachusetts Tries Something New To Claim Taxes From Online Sales
item.description: June 2, 2017 - States have long argued that they are losing millions of dollars in uncollected taxes from online sales. Massachusetts is now trying a very Internet answer to this Internet problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - States have long argued that they are losing millions of dollars in uncollected taxes from online sales. Massachusetts is now trying a very Internet answer to this Internet problem. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/02/531222247/massachusetts-tries-something-new-to-claim-taxes-from-online-sales

item.title: A 1A Special: Putting Paris In Perspective
item.description: June 1, 2017 - President Trump has made his decision – and plans to withdraw the United States from the 2015 Paris climate agreement. It’s a move that places Washington at odds with virtually the entire international community.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - President Trump has made his decision – and plans to withdraw the United States from the 2015 Paris climate agreement. It’s a move that places Washington at odds with virtually the entire international community. http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-01/a-1a-special-putting-paris-in-perspective

item.title: In $43 Million Settlement, Spotify Forced To Confront A Persistent Problem
item.description: June 1, 2017 - The streaming service settled a class action lawsuit filed by songwriters who accused Spotify of using their work without a license.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - The streaming service settled a class action lawsuit filed by songwriters who accused Spotify of using their work without a license. http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/06/01/531029555/in-43-million-settlement-spotify-forced-to-confront-a-persistent-problem

item.title: Banned From Russian TV, A Putin Critic Gets His Message Out On YouTube
item.description: June 1, 2017 - Anti-corruption campaigner Alexei Navalny is calling for nationwide protests and wants to be president. The Kremlin is scrambling to respond to the freewheeling weekly show he's started on YouTube.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - Anti-corruption campaigner Alexei Navalny is calling for nationwide protests and wants to be president. The Kremlin is scrambling to respond to the freewheeling weekly show he's started on YouTube. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/06/01/530322343/banned-from-russian-tv-a-putin-critic-gets-his-message-out-on-youtube

item.title: Amazon Offers Refunds For Children's Unauthorized In-App Purchases
item.description: May 31, 2017 - The Federal Trade Commission sued the retail giant over charges incurred by kids using apps. Both sides dropped their appeals so the refunds could begin.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 31, 2017 - The Federal Trade Commission sued the retail giant over charges incurred by kids using apps. Both sides dropped their appeals so the refunds could begin. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/31/530903237/amazon-offers-refunds-for-childrens-unauthorized-in-app-purchases
